sourceCodeSystem.identifierName: Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes

concept.designation: This LOINC term is currently used as the Clinical Document code for both the Care Record Summary (CRS) and Continuity of Care Document (CCD).

A document that summarizes all of the currently prescribed medications for a patient at a given point in time (such as the end of a hospitalization or other encounter) as known by the document's author. It may contain additional medication-related information such as allergies. The purpose of this document is to inform the patient and other clinicians (therapists| etc) of the current medication information.
A document showing patient acknowledgement/consent/dissent with respect to the privacy policies of an organization. This document is specific to an individual patient.
Document used to prescribe drugs (Note: it is the document| not the medication).

This document is a concise clinical document that provides an electronic| pre-defined patient health data set applicable both for unexpected| as well as expected (planned)| health care contact. This document may be either the product of a medical act or an automatic excerpt from national/regional EHRs.A Patient Summary gives a healthcare provider the essential information needed for health care coordination and| in cases of an unexpected need or when the patient consults a provider other than his regular contact person (e.g. the general practitioner he/she is registered with)| this document enables continuity of care. Because it is meant to be a summary| this document might not include a detailed medical history| details on clinical conditions or a full list of all prescriptions and dispensed medicines.

This medication dispensed information collection includes information useful for describing the dispensed drugs and the supply act (who did what and when)| the context where the document was produced| and additional administrative information if requested. Some of the additional information may include specification of the kinds of exemptions a patient may have (e.g. older than a specified age| pregnant| etc)| or specification of financial information (e.g. the amount of co-payment).
